Dialogue:
CO: Good morning!
CN: Good morning!
CO: What do you do on your days off?
CN: Doing housework and reading.
CO: Do you enjoy reading?
CN: Yes, I like you!
CO: What have you read recently?
CN: I am reading a book on health management.
CO: That sounds interesting.
CN: Lately, I've been feeling unwell more often.
CO: I see. Have you been managing it until now?
CN: I haven't done much.
CO: Was it due to a less healthy lifestyle?
CN: The biggest factor is decreased commuting due to COVID-19, reducing physical activity.
CO: I see. Are you doing anything about it now?
CN: I try to walk for about 30 minutes.
CO: That’s good. I’m doing it too.
CN: Have you chosen a specific route?
CO: Yes, there is a park nearby, so I walk there.
CN: Sounds good. My house is near the road.
CO: I see. How far do you walk?
CN: It is about 1 to 2 kilometers.
CO: That’s good. Continuity is important, right?
CN: Yes. I feel like I sleep better when I exercise.
CO: Definitely, I feel the same.
CN: If I don't leave the house, I don't sleep well.
CO: Is it good to get moderately tired?
CN: I feel the need to move my body.
CO: Talking about this motivates me.
CN: Yes, knowing others are doing it helps!

CO: Good morning!
CN: Good morning!
CO: Do you like watching sports?
CN: I enjoy it! I often watch baseball.
CO: High school baseball has started.
CN: Yes, it has. My home prefecture lost early on.
CO: Was the opponent a strong team?
CN: Yes, they were a strong team. The game was worth watching.
CO: Do you attend the games in person?
CN: I used to attend professional baseball games.
CO: That sounds nice.
CN: Baseball is fun, and you can also enjoy ballpark gourmet food these days.
CO: I'm not familiar with ballpark food.
CN: There are menus produced by the athletes.
CO: Interesting, I haven't been there recently.
CN: They feature the favorite foods of athletes and local specialties.
CO: Any recommendations?
CN: The menu changes every season, but the karaage bowl was delicious.
CO: I'll check it out next time. Do you have a favorite baseball team?
CN: I like watching the Carp.
CO: Are you from Hiroshima?
CN: Yes. Do you have a favorite baseball team?
CO: I liked the Giants when I was a child.
CN: Are you not supporting any team now?
CO: I prefer soccer now.
CN: Where do you watch soccer?
CO: I watch matches of Japanese athletes overseas.
CN: Overseas matches are impressive, but Japanese ones are also great.
CO: Yes, but the time difference makes it tough. I end up sleep-deprived.
CN: The time difference can be challenging.
